1133.content:
So it might have been nothing.

Like, Piper might have been able to convince herself that it was just a trick of the light or something. She was still kinda sleepy and their Mom had a thing against overhead lighting. Maybe it was like the way she was sitting or something or maybe it was the way Parker was sitting or whatever. Piper told herself that it could have been anything...

But as Parker stretched like a cat, throwing her olive toned arms up in the air and arched her back, Piper would have been hard pressed to find an excuse for that little belly that poked out from underneath Parker's old Ke$ha t-shirt. Underneath the blue and purple hem, Parker's stretching had released a little curve. And as she settled back into her place, her daily Steve Wilkos indulgence commencing, she sat back in a way that didn't quite allow her shirt room to fall back over the little roll nestled on top of her previously flat stomach.

And honestly, the more Piper looked at her... Parker just seemed a little bigger than usual, y'know?

It wasn't really a surprise or anything. Parker had the motivation and drive of a slug. All she did was lay around the house all day, shuffling from her room to the couch to the pantry before she and a couple of her degenerate friends from high school got together and decided to go out clubbing. With the amount of alcohol that her sister consumed on a daily basis, Piper was honestly kind've shocked she hadn't gone into liver failure—let alone put on a couple of pounds.

Were those actual love handles?

"God can you believe this?" Parker snorted, "What a piece of trash, right?"

"What?" Piper blinked, distracted by the emergence of the slightest second chin whenever her sister spoke, "I, uh... what?"

"Like, of course he's the father, right?" Parker continued, clearly as engaged as their conversation as Piper was as she cracked a Coke open, "Gawd. Like, she looks just like him. These are just straight garbage-tier people."

Parker lifted the coke can over her head and killed it—Piper had seen her do that plenty of times with beer. Maybe that was where all that mysterious mass had come from? She had been drinking a lot of soda lately, come to think of it. But then again, she—

"BURRAAARRP!!" Parker let out a belch loud enough to rattle the panes on their sliding glass door, "Ururp... damn. That was a good one."

"It was." Piper conceded, "Bravo."

Okay, so she wasn't that different. Honestly, Piper was surprised by this point that Parker hadn't started filling out beforehand. All that girl did was eat, party, drink and sleep. Even still, should she say something? Like, it may have been rude to call someone out on their weight, but Parker looked to have put a lot of it on. They were still sisters, after all...
1133.title: What's the Pudge On Parker?

choices: Ugh... being a good person sucks—Piper investigates...
Why should she care? Piper does nothing while Parker balloons!
11332.content:
"Hey Pitstain." Parker belched again, this time more quietly and directly aimed at Piper's face, "Gimme another Coke."

And that was the moment that Piper's sisterly duty ended, and a sudden apathy overtook her as to whether or not Parker became the size of a house. Who cared what Parker did to herself, right? It wasn't like she was much help around the house. Or fun to talk to. Or particularly nice or redeeming in anyway... hence the burp in the face. Why should Piper put in the effort of being a good sister when Parker had done everything but?

"Ugh, get it yourself." Piper curled her nostril and kicked her sister in the thicker thigh, "Friggin' gross Parker."

"Fine." the older Black sister rolled her eyes as she poured herself onto the cheap hardwood floor, "You're such a baby."

And there too, Piper noticed it. Whatever weight Parker had put on, it had settled nicely in the seat of her pants. Whereas the Black women tended to be busty by nature, Parker's posterior seemed a bit more plush than Piper cared to recall. It wasn't just the softness of her stomach; Parker had packed away an awful lot more junk in her trunk since Piper cared to look. Had she always had that thing? That bubble butt jutting out behind her? No, couldn't be. Otherwise it wouldn't be that big of a deal now... right?

Piper let the Steve Wilkos show play in the background—she wasn't really into daytime talk shows anyway—as she waited for Parker to return from the kitchen. Sure enough, there was that little pot-belly she'd sprouted miraculously without her knowledge, just sort've hanging out there. It was this little round pooch, no folds or rolls, and two little dollops of olive-colored chub that made up her lovehandles. Her boobs were bigger, that much Piper could tell. Her shirt was riding up ever so slightly thanks to those meaty mams, leaving just a little sliver of Parker pudge out in the open...

Parker plopped down next to her sister on the couch, cracked open her cola, and took a big fizzy gulp.

"Ahh." she sounded content with herself before— "URRRAAAP!! That's the stuff..."—she burped triumphantly again, "You want one, twerp?"

"Yeah, sure." Piper said with a furrowed black brow, her concern unnoticed by her softer sister

"Cool, grab me another one when you do?" Parker kicked her legs up on the ottoman, "Save me a trip."

Jesus Tapdancing Christ, what had gotten into her? Parker was lazy, but she was...

Okay, Parker was always this exact amount of lazy. Literally all the time. She was the only twenty-something year old without a job within a three block radius. Piper wished she could have been surprised, but no. Parker had always been useless and lazy. And honestly, Piper was less shocked that her sister was getting fat, and more shocked that it hadn't started happening sooner.

Even still, she was getting awfully chunky...
11332.title: Not Her Sister's Keeper

choices: Piper gets her some fucking Pizza
Piper gives her a pep talk to get back into shape.
113322.content:
"What? What do you mean I don't really fit your scene anymore? What's that supposed to mean?!" Parker's voice screeched through the thin walls of Casa de Black. She had been going on like this for almost an hour. At first Piper had put her headphones on and just tried to watch some Netflix, but Bojack Horseman wasn't the same when occasionally punctuated by an overgrown womanchild. So Piper turned it off, got herself and aspirin and was just...waiting, for it to be over.

         She knew it was Parker's ho-bag friend, Tina. Tina always came around in these tiny miniskirt dresses that had one shoulder exposed, way too much makeup and hairspray, and was basically everything Piper hated about Parker, purified and concentrated with a dash of redneck. Because both horrid bitches, Paker and Tina had a fight like this about once every three months, usually over literally nothing. Maybe one of them forgot the other's purse when they left it with them, while they were both drunk, or maybe they were fighting over a guy who just pumped and dumped them anyway.

         "Fuck you! Fuck YOU!" And then she threw the phone against the wall right behind Piper's head. Piper had enough and stormed out of her room and threw open Parker's door. She was about to tear into her with every grievance she'd accumulated over the last few weeks, but then she saw something she hadn't seen since she was like, five years old. Parker was crying.

         Piper just stood in the doorway, waiting for something to happen. Finally Parker let it out between heaving sobs.

         "Tina doesn't want to be seen with me anymore! She says I'm fat and disgusting!" Well...Piper couldn't dispute the fat part. Parker had eaten herself into plus sizes. The Black family had always hovered around there, being slightly taller then average, and all being what they now called thicc, but Parker had jumped straight up there. She'd even gone to Torrid especially to buy a size 22 dress that would fit her to go out tonight, and it was a bit...clingy.

         As for disgusting well...Parker was a tramp who now had a habit of burping anytime she was in the room, calling her 'pitstain,' her mascara was running from crying and her hair was a trainwreck. But still! She was her sister!

         So she came up onto Parker's bed an hugged her, and for once, Parker didn't protest. As she wrapped her fingers around her sister's shoulder, she found it incredible how much padding even that had. Sitting here, this close to her, she really couldn't believe it. This was Parker?

         "Come on, Tina was a total bitch anyway, even to you." Piper insisted. Sometimes she wondered if the problem was that Parker fell in with the wrong crowd. Tina and her friends were the only ones who actually hung out with Piper, starting when they got out of High School. And since Tina was everything bad about Parker, but worse, Tina was probably a terrible influence. Piper had a hard time hiding the glee she had at the thought of never seeing Tina again, which didn't do much to help Parker.

         "Remember when you got glue in your hair that one time, and then Tina told everyone that you got hair extensions? Come on, you're better off without her." That only provoked further wailing. OK, time to change tactics.

         "What would make you feel better, right now, sis?"

         "Right now?"

         "Right now."

         "Pizza."

If Piper and Parker were going to have to grow up and get out of their little nerd cave, they were going to have some fun before they did it. Harper had warned them that they would be getting off of their expansive asses “tomorrow”, but she hadn’t specified when tomorrow. Piper had successfully convinced their mom that they were going to go out for one last hurrah before they got the new year off right. Just a little get-together, nothing special. There was a party going down at Dauphin Towers—Piper’s pals Hurley and Yanira had let them know about it. And they always threw the best ragers. Plenty of booze, plenty of friendly faces, and more importantly… plenty of food! You don’t get to be Hurley’s size without a wife that cooks like Yanira! Even if everything else sucked, at least there’d be some grub to chow down on.

“Like, I mean, you holding it back there yeah.”

“I’m thinking of tying it off.” Piper said with a proud pat to her pudgy paunch, “Letting it all hang out.”

“You don’t have the figure for it.” Parker made a face as she scarfed down a couple of pizza pockets, “Cover up that jelly.”

“You cover up yours.” Piper spat back, “I’m looking pretty hot right about now…”

As the night grew darker and Parker’s confidence wore thin, Piper finally dragged her outside to the Black Family’s puttering old minivan. Just about the time that could be considered “fashionably late” for a girl like Piper, the silver Honda came to a halt in the parking lot, and the Black sisters wobbled inside.

Piper had dressed in a tight t-shirt with short sleeves that pinched the small layer of fat that coated her arms. Her breasts distorted the Floating Heads logo beyond all recognition, and her tummy rolled out to ride it up all the way along the soft brown curvature. She filled the seat of her jeans well as her broad butt and wide hips pressed tightly against the faded denim. Her hair was down, letting her long black locks flow freely in the night.

Meanwhile her sister, immensely fat and swollen beyond recognition, wasn’t nearly as confident. She waddled meekly and slowly, her fat quivering with every step. She looked around hesitantly as if she were afraid of running into someone she knew. And why shouldn’t she be? Parker had blimped up! Even if they had seen her, no one would have recognized her as the lithe attractive lush who partied her brains out around Daven’s Port. Instead they’d only see a busty zeppelin floating behind her… her more attractive sister…

The realization hit Parker right in the gut.

“You ready to go inside?” Piper asked flirtatiously

“I… I don’t know, P.”

“Come on. Don’t be such a baby!” Piper wrapped her arms around Parker’s and pulled the heavier girl, “Do you want to get laid or not?”

The sisters waddled towards the door…

“Well uh..yeah.” Parker admitted, her pudgy hands rubbing her couch filling sides contemplatively. She almost seemed hurt, but the fact that she was incredibly, inhumanly obese was too obvious to deny or shrug off. “But so are you?”

Piper’s heart sank into her stomach. Her stomach, she didn’t even feel it expand. It was already there. A big weight upon her. She turned down to look at it, but her chins got in the way. Her arms and legs splayed out to make room for the impending bulk. Piper felt her face drowning in fat as it sank lower and lower into the meat surrounding her head, her chins bunching up against her shoulders, and her cheeks blocking out part of her field of vision. She could barely move her head, it was so encased in fat, so she could only stare at the TV screen in horror as fat filled her field of view, first from her puffy cheeks, and then the slowly rising mountain of flesh that was her now pale belly. It rose up so high she could barely see the TV past it. Her arms felt her massive side rolls and hips. Even bending her fingers was hard, like she was wearing really thick gloves. They must be fat little sausages too. She tried to raise her hand in front of her face, and found it took considerable effort. She felt her giant bingo wings flapping against her with a wet slap with every little effort. When she saw it, her hand was like a ball of flab, with stubby, swollen fingers attached, covered in a thick layer of Dorito dust. Without even realizing it, she brought her fingers to her mouth and liked off some of the coating.

This chilled her to the bone. It was a small thing, compared to her expansion, but it was something she could grasp. She couldn’t recognize her own hand. She couldn’t recognize her own behavior. Her brain then started making further rational connections: She was just pinned up against the edge of the couch by Parker. She looked over at her with some effort, and Parker was just as much a blob as ever. They both fit on the same couch somehow. Was it the same couch? Oh my god, was that the same TV? Was this the same house? She couldn’t tell. She had a hard time piecing together details, what exactly looked different about this place. Because she could remember perfectly how everything got here. Even the towering piles of pizza boxes, and other debris of her and her sisters constant gorging. She could remember watching that pile grow taller and taller for weeks, wondering when someone would be bothered to take it out. She remembered it but…she also remembered things being different. This all felt somehow wrong. Most of all, she knew she shouldn’t feel trapped like this, by her own body.

“I…” Piper grunted. A new horror. She couldn’t recognize her own voice. It came out thick and wet and deep. “I don’t know what’s going on.” She admitted, terrified. Parker started to try and shift her tremendous bulk to somehow move herself closer to Piper.

“Piper, are you OK?” She asked, sounding and looking tremendously concerned. “Do you want me to try and get a doctor or something?”

“Since when do you care?” Piper instinctual scoffed, then gasped for breath. Even this much conversation was exhausting.

“Piper, of course I care. I’m your sister and you’re my best friend. And I’m really worried about you.”

Piper never heard Parker speak to her like that before. A new body, a new voice, and now a whole different attitude. Piper had no idea what to make of this. It was like talking to an entirely new person. A person who evidently cared about her.

“I don’t know, things are…I feel like I’m losing my mind.” Piper stumbled.

“Hey, you can tell me anything, remember?” Parker said, speaking immediately and directly, despite panting and beginning to sweat from this much talking. Piper took a deep breath, closed her eyes, and gathered her thoughts.

13112.content:
The fortunes and paths of the Black family had been up and down over the years, and Piper hadn't been an exception to that rule.

After The Deadbeat had left her for the final time, Harper had been left with three daughters to raise by herself. Working two jobs to support her struggling family had meant her girls often went unsupervised, and the two elder girls had certainly taken advantage of that.

Parker and Piper had both been fairly wild in high school. Detentions, suspensions, cutting class, failing tests, and partying to all hours had been the norm, and Piper felt bad for how much stress she'd caused her Mom and Buby over the years.

It had seemed that Piper the Punk was destined for the life of the perpetual slacker, until she carried on the family tradition and got knocked up by some loser. Before such a thing could occur, though, two things had come along and changed her life forever.

The first was the birth of her younger sister, Hunter. Suddenly, there was a life that depended on her frequently, as Harper was still working terrible hours (the two woman agreeing that they should NEVER rely on Parker for this). Whether Piper meant to or not, she quickly became a reliable homemaker and caretaker for her newborn sibling. Her Buby even started teaching her how to cook, though it was admittedly an uphill battle.

Still, at least she could now boil a pot of rice without nearly burning the house down (again).

The other was meeting a new to town girl from Texas by the name of Dakota Johnson. She was a beanpole, a nerd, and honestly kind of awkward. In the not too distant past, Piper would have been teasing the ever-loving sh*t out of a girl like her. For some reason, Piper instead started spending time with her, and the two quickly became the best of friends.

Though, to be fair, Piper still did tease her a bit.

Dakota's book smarts had proven to be a good match to Piper's street smarts, and as Miss Black realized that she needed to accomplish more in life then spotting off another pack of Natty Light, Dakota proved an invaluable resource to the struggling student. Piper managed to significantly improve her grades, and she could proudly claim to be the first member of her family to move on to post-secondary.

Piper had done a two year program at the local Daven's Port college, attending and successfully graduating from their computer science program.

Dakota, meanwhile, had gone to the Daven's Port Uni's College of Medicine, aiming to become a Registered Nurse. It was a four year program, plus a year of internship, so Miss Johnson was still in school and racking up an impressive amount of debt.

As for Piper's oldest friend, Zack, he'd moved straight into the work force after high school. He'd had his start in construction, then apprenticed as a roofer. About eight months ago, he'd started his own company, and when Piper last spoke to him, was booked solid for the next several weeks.

Also, the fact that his new career had led to some pretty impressive muscles brought a blush to Piper's face a fair bit more then she'd care to admit.

After her grad, though, Piper had struggled to find work. It may have been the information age, but unfortunately it seemed everyone else was also aware of that. She was typically one of several applicants, seldom got called for an interview, and never saw a second. Piper figured it was her lack of work experience that was hurting her, but it was awfully hard to gain any XP when no one was willing to give her a chance.

For the better part of six months, Piper was planted on the living room couch, occasionally firing off her resume to a potential employer, disappointed every time. Accomplishing nothing more then watching trashy daytime TV and eating mounds of junk food, Piper felt like she was wasting her life away.

Until last week, that is.

The Yeng Corporation was an international giant, and they were currently in the midst of a major expansion outside of their native Japan. Daven's Port had been home to a small R&D house for years, but now the company was significantly expanding their local operations, and the once quiet port town was quite simply booming.

Yeng had built a new office building downtown and had put out a notice for around 250-ish job openings. When Piper had applied, she never thought in her wildest dreams that they would call her back.

When they did, she damn near dropped her milk shake.

One interview and an orientation later, and Miss Piper Black was now an employee of the Yeng Corporation. And now we come back to the present day, where Piper is beginning her journey to her new workplace...

*** *** ***

As she left the house, her older sister's words echoed in her mind. "You won't last a day. Your blubbery gut will be back on that sofa by the end of the week."

Logically, Piper knew that Parker was full of it. As she'd gotten her life together, her layabout sibling had become increasingly hostile, which for Parker was quite the accomplishment. Piper could only guess as to why, though it was clearly related to the fact that she was getting her life on track rather then Parker's "Party Hard, Pay Never" ways.

Emotionally was a very different story, however. Piper had only held two jobs before, and was fired from both after about a week. She'd found it really funny as a teen, but now she kept wondering if something was indeed wrong with her. Was she unhireable? Could she hold down a job? Or was she destined to lose this one and couch surf until the day she died. Or maybe she'd get lucky and become a trophy wife for some rich man? Or was she too crude for that? God, would she have to do porn?

Piper shook her head to stop that wicked train of thought from running away with her.

As she walked down their front stairs, a slight jiggling sensation brought her attention to the other major problem she had with her sister's pronouncement. Namely, that she was gaining weight again, and had been for some time.

Now, Piper had been fairly rotund in her youth. The family diet was less then stellar, and she'd always eaten far more then her share. The end result, as you might imagine, was the chubby little girl blossoming into a pretty fat kid. By the time she entered middle school, Piper was struggling to fit in the desks, and gym class was simply a joke. Had it not been for the sudden onset of puberty and a killer growth spurt, she likely would have continued to balloon. Instead, she became one of the true beauties of her school, and nearly every boy had fantasies about her.

However, that state of affairs was not to last. Really, she was hit across the board. The improving family finances meant that she longer had to do without, and could pig out whenever she wanted. Being more responsible with Dakota meant she was staying at home, whether studying or watching a movie, snacking as opposed to partying. She'd eaten all her woes away in college, and all her fears of unemployment and debt had been buried under bags of chips and slices of pizza.

Combining all that food with a rather sedentary lifestyle had only one result; Piper had gained a lot of weight. From 120 pounds at her thinnest, the former rail had steadily ballooned over the last few years. When she'd last weighed herself, she'd been a hefty 236 pounds, though that had been back when she graduated in June. She tried not to think about how much she must have put on since.

Yanking down on her tight work blouse, Piper was really regretting not buying a new set of clothes before her first day. Still, she tried to put it out of her mind as she walked the half a block to the bus stop, ready for her first day of work.

131121.content:
"A bus stop right in front of the building? That's really convenient," Piper thought as she stepped off her bus. She walked the few short yards and entered into the air conditioned lobby. A long information desk was directly in front of the glass doors, and Piper headed towards it.

Behind the desk sat a tall, leggy blonde. She was stick thin, and her bountiful curls were tied back into a loose pony tail. She smiled as Piper came towards her. "Hello, and welcome to Yeng's Daven's Port office. Do you have an appointment?"

"Actually, I'm Piper Black. I'm starting today in the I.T. department."

"Oh! Well, welcome aboard, then! I'm Stacy, by the way. Stacy Reynauld."

"It's nice to meet you," Piper said as she shook the enthusiastic woman's hand.

"Same! I'll page Mr. Brownstone for you, and while we're waiting, start getting you set up." Stacey turned towards her computer, and quickly typed out a message. Checking her screen once more, she opened her desk drawer before continuing. "Okay, so here's your name tag and security pass. The pass also doubles as your punch card, so when you swipe in or out with security, it clocks you in and out. You'll want to take the door on the right; our PR offices are on the left, so they're readily available for customers and what have you."

Anything else Stacy would have said was interrupted by the opening of the right hand door. An older man walked out. He was dressed in a quality black suit, with a red tie. His salt and pepper black hair was kept short, and a welcoming smile broke his clean shaven face. He extended a hand as he stepped forward. "Miss Black, I presume? I'm Malcolm Brownstone, Director of Human Resources. If you'll follow me, please."

Brownstone turned and walked ahead of Piper. Malcolm was built like a human scarecrow, and honestly looked like he might be able to bench press a solid 35 pounds, but he walked very quickly and Piper struggled to keep up. The two walked past the currently empty security desk, pausing only a moment to swipe their cards before continuing along.

"I apologize if I seem like I'm rushing you, but given we're building this office up from scratch, there's about a hundred things to do, and the list just keeps on growing. Our new security personnel will be starting later this week, so don't get used to this desk being empty.

"This," he said as the two entered a large, open area. "Is our main floor. Most of the desks here are for data entry, a small call center, and the like. Each floor has a break room and bathroom, and the lunch room is on the third floor."

"Awful lot of vending machines," Piper said. She had thought she was muttering, but the way Malcolm responded, it was clear she wasn't.

"Yes, each and everyone stocked with our fine in-house products. This is probably a good point to discuss your Yeng credits."

"Yeng credits?"

"Yes," Malcolm said as the two entered the elevator. He pressed the button for the 19th floor, and continued as the lift began to move upward. "Each employee receives a weekly allotment of Yeng credits to spend at the vending machines, or to use in the lunchroom. They will accept cash as well, but given the credits are a free perk, it's usually a good idea to use them first. Everything for sale in the building is also offered to employees at a sizeable discount as well, so the credits will go quite far. As your tenure with the company increases, you'll start receiving additional credits as a bonus at regular intervals. The credits also don't expire, though you aren't allowed to transfer them between employees."

The elevator dinged, and the doors slid open. Malcolm continued, "The I.T. offices are here on the 19th floor."

Walking past a fistful of vending machines and a bathroom, he pointed to a door to the right. It was an impressively large opening, at least 48 inches wide, and with no obvious door knob or handle. "And this is you."

Piper was, in a rare moment, shocked to silence. She hadn't been expecting to be given her own office, but there was her name in an embossed brass plaque. As Malcolm pushed a large button beside the entryway, the door slid silently into the wall. The office behind was as large as the opening, with a large desk and the biggest office chair Piper had ever seen. A couple plants sat on a small table by the large windows, and she was rather surprised to see a pair of vending machines, one for soft drinks and one for food, standing in the corner.

"I... I have an office?"

The older director smiled at the incredulity in the new hire's voice. "That you do, Miss Black. We at Yeng have found through focused studies, as well as trial and error, that maintaining employee comfort maximizes both productivity and employee retention. Our benefits package is also second to none in the city.

"Anyway," he said as he passed her a card, "this is your current password. Please change that after the first time you log in. Today will be mostly training videos and the like, but you'll be thrown into the thick of it almost immediately, I'm afraid. We're still in the middle of networking the building, so there's no shortage of stuff to do.

"I hate to run, but I'm expecting no fewer then 88 new hires arriving over the course of the day. I'll let you get to it, and we'll go from there. I hope you come to enjoy working for Yeng corporation."

As the door slid closed behind the Director, Piper turned around and let out a breath she didn't know she was holding. "Holy crap. My own office. Holy crap."

Piper walked slowly around the large space, running her hands along the walls, as if disbelieving that was in fact hers. As she slowly lowered herself into the surprisingly comfy chair, she felt almost impishly small for the gargantuan seat.

"Jesus, were they expecting only land whales to apply for these jobs? Really comfy, though. Wonder if I can get something a bit more my size?"

As Piper was logging into her computer, she looked at the vending machines in the corner. As the machine slowly came to life, she decided to test her company credits while she waited. Rolling the chair over as opposed to walking, she swiped her card and worked through the interactive touchscreen.

"Let's see what we have here. Oh wow, these prices are ridiculously low. Holy hell, I don't even think I can make a dent in this card. What do I want...

Let's grab one of those honey cakes. Those chips look good. Ooo, donuts! Nice! Oh, and some cookies.

Now, how about the beverages... Jesus! Why is Yeng Cola half a credit, and water 24 credits!? Who priced that!? Well, grab a cola, then."

Rolling back with her haul, Piper set her packages down on her desk. As she started the first of many tedious training videos, Miss Black took a big bite of her first honey cake.

"Wow, those are damn good."
131121.title: To Yeng!

choices: Onto Part II
1311212.content:
“Huh, let's see. Anything else? No, that should be it.” Piper leaned back in her sinfully comfortable chair. It took her well over two hours to wade through mounds of -virtual- paperwork that followed first training videos and since she at least tried to understand all that legalese, it made her feel groggy now. Groggy and maybe a little peckish.

There were several other videos queued up and a workplace safety quiz too but now she was drained. Perhaps another Yeng Cola could perk her up? When Piper recalled its invigorating effects from earlier, she rolled the chair over to the vending machine, swiped the card and punched it in.

As she sipped the bubbly beverage, she couldn't stop looking at the long list of snacks. Piper knew she shouldn't, she'd already eaten plenty this morning but those mozzarella sticks looked really inviting… Engrossed in her thoughts, Piper was startled when she heard a knock on the door. Was it a manager, here to check her productivity? Would she be in trouble? She knew she had to make a good first impression. “Who's there?”

“Umm, Rob Watford, may I come in?”

“Yeah, of course.” Piper quickly rolled away from the machine and bent down to hide the Yeng Cola behind her desk.

A young, portly man entered. The first things Piper noticed was an unkempt beard and plethora of dark hair. A ratty T-shirt with a weird logo stretched over his potbelly and his sartorial ensemble was crowned by tattered jeans. This was no manager. “Hi.”

"Hi. Are you… Ms. Black?” His last words turned into a squeal when he noticed her chest rise behind the desk. He opened his mouth again, only to spray chip crumbs all around. “Oops, sorry,” he chuckled sheepishly, his eyes still drawn to Piper's assets.

Piper sighed. How old was he, fifteen? “Yeah? What brings you here?”

“Uh, well, my office is next door and I found out that the canteen is already open so… Wanna go have lunch?”

“Already? What time is it, eleven?” Still, better go to lunch than stuff herself with junk food like her new acquaintance. Or like she was about to do but Piper pushed that thought away. “Yeah, sure.” She pushed herself upright, the hydraulics in her chair hissing as she vacated it. Standing, she found was a little taller than the boy which made his eyes swivel back into her cleavage. She seriously thought about punching him. But first day at work popped up in her mind so instead she pointed at the door to make him look away. “Lead the way.”

“Uh, I don't know the way either but the orientation video said it takes up most of the third floor.” Rob pointed at the lift.

Her door clicked behind them, locking itself. Piper checked if she had her card on her. “I haven't seen that video yet,” she admitted.

“Yeah, well, I haven't seen most of them but this one's important! You need to know where you're getting your grub!” He emphasised his words by grabbing a bunch of chips and stuffing it into his mouth.

“By the way, why are you eating chips when you're going to lunch?”

“Why not? They're almost gone anyway. Oops, sorry. Want some too?” he offered her the family bag.

Piper knew she shouldn't. The jiggle she felt at every step told her so. But the guy was friendly, if nerdishly awkward, and she didn't want to alienate him this early. “Sure, thanks.” She took a handful and poured it into her mouth.

***


Piper had been expecting something like a school cafeteria – she'd seen plenty of those in her life. And she wasn't that far off a target. Sure, this one was clean, spotless even, and at this hour almost empty too, but she spotted only two major differences. One, throughout the hall there were so many square pillars or columns or whatever, each table had one in its middle. And two… “Uh, Rob? Can you see where we're supposed to get our food?”

“Oh, right, there aren't any serving tables… Look! Over there!” Piper followed his pointing hand to a skinny employee who was here even earlier than them. She was just taking her tray out of an opening in one of the columns. “You order at your table and they serve it to you through one of those shafts. Now that's what I call high-tech!”

“But how do you order?”

“Uh, we'll find out at a table? Come on, let's go there.”

Now Piper noticed another difference from a school canteen. This place smelled nice. Their pace and beat quickened as they hurried to seize a table nearby. “I wonder why they're so big. They could've easily put two chairs to each side, not just one.” She was right, there was enough space for 8 or even 12 people at each square table but there was only one chair on each side.

“Huh, perhaps the building's half empty since they're still hiring? Anyway, who cares. I want to know how I am supposed to order. I don't see…”

“I do.” Piper was happy that this time she was the attentive one. “Look, there's a touchscreen under this wooden panel.” It lit at her touch, offering her a complete menu. As her upbringing taught her, she looked at prices first and soon exclaimed: “69 credits for salad?! Now that's absurd.”

Seated diagonally across the table, Rob chuckled. “Come on. You weren't going to order a salad, were you?”

“Well, no, Rob, but still…” She settled for lasagna and another Yeng Cola, nothing else. At mere 14,25 credits it was the cheapest meal on offer. Frankly, she was worried she might still be a tad hungry – but no, she'd had all those snacks before! This must be enough for her lunch.

Soon enough the middle column chimed and opened and two trays rolled out. And she found out she needn't have worried. Her portion was an entire pan of lasagna! A small pan, to be sure, but she doubted she'd be able to eat it all.

Her thoughts were interrupted by an exclamation. “Let's chew!” and she saw her companion eagerly attack a huge steak. Piper followed his example. It was so tasty, delicious and greasy. Only once before she'd eaten homemade lasagna, made by Dakota's mother, and this was… this was even better. Sorry, Dakota's Mom, she thought as she shovelled the pan contents into her mouth.

Piper ate like possessed, lost in a trance, not seeing nor hearing anything or anyone, not even Rob Watford. She was surprised when her fork picked up last scraps, she couldn't believe she'd already eaten it all. Her trance broken, she raised her head to look around.

The lunch room was filling with people, it was over half full now, but there still wasn't much noise. She supposed most people were too busy eating like her new friend. He seemed to be struggling, pink in face and leaning back in his chair, but he still kept laboriously chewing a bite after bite of a huge cheesecake portion.

Its smell was so enticing, Piper realised when she noticed it. And given how much Rob was enjoying it… almost against her will she brought up the menu again. Only 4 credits? I can easily afford that. It's my first day on the job, I can splurge a little.

***


/and character limit strikes again/

13112121.content:
Piper wasn't one for post-lunch naps – she always made fun of Mum for that! – but after this lunch her brain simply switched off. It was a struggle to walk back to her office and then she simply collapsed into her chair. It didn't help that it was so big and comfy that it felt more like bed to her. She didn't want to sleep but as she launched another boring video, her eyes started closing on their own accord…

Piper awoke with a start. Had she slept through the afternoon? On her first day? They'd surely kick her out again! A quick glance at her phone and she sighed in relief. It was only 3:13 p.m. She woke up her computer, picked up the opened bottle of Yeng Cola and rushed to complete her daily tasks.

About an hour later, just as she was finishing the safety quiz, her inbox started flashing. Piper quickly guessed the last answer, pressed the last enter, glanced at her score (78% with 75 required to pass, nothing to write home about but at her present state it was the best she could hope for) and opened her work e-mail.

Dear new employee of Yeng Corporation, she read,
the Director of Human Resources would like to address you at 16:30 sharp in the building lunch room. Please be punctual.

How many did the director say they were taking in today? Ninety? Piper knew this could easily be the dealbreaker. First impression were the most important. She quickly closed all the windows, logged herself out, cleaned out all the empty wrappers and rushed to the lifts, glad that her door was self-locking.

When she got downstairs, there were already several dozen others milling about in the hallway. As far as she could see, Rob was not among them. Piper wondered what next when Mr. Brownstone's voice shouted from behind. “What are you waiting for? It's open. For your convenience, the lunch room is open all day long. If you need a snack or a meal at uncommon times, you'll be welcome. Now find a seat and listen.”

While everybody was sitting down, he slowly walked to a speaker pedestal that wasn't there at lunch and started speaking about values and principles of the company they joined. He went on in the same rather vague vein for several minutes, mentioned their duties and eventually announced: “At Yeng we like productivity and initiative. And we reward them accordingly. To give you an idea, your first day at work has been carefully monitored. I am now transferring 500 Yeng credits,” he brought up his tablet, “to the accounts of the twelve of you who have already finished all entry procedures. You know who you are and now you know we appreciate you.”

Piper felt her cheeks colouring. Did she really finish it all? Wasn't there a video or two she missed?

Meanwhile Mr. Brownstone spoke on: “But even those of you who didn't finish it yet need not despair. There were other minor rewards distributed for your achievements today. Almost everyone of you is a diligent enough worker to be eligible. If you like, you may now log into the lunch room terminals to see how much you got. Enjoy them but remember, from now on these bonuses will be much harder to get. So be ready to give it your best and you'll be noticed.”

Seeing everyone else do it, Piper also logged and was welcomed by a scrolling text:
Dear employee of Yeng Corporation,
today you have been awarded the following bonuses…
And there it was! +500 Yeng credits for completing first day assignments. But there was more: +50 credits for sampling the Yeng merchandise, +20 for meeting your colleagues, even 10 credits for coming on time to the DHR address and another 10 for keeping the workplace tidy – Piper congratulated herself for collecting all the waste before she left. Overall she earned a nice bonus on her first day of work

“Oh, one last reminder from Catering – please remember that the company lunch room is open until 8 p.m. so do not hesitate to come and eat your dinners here too, starting today. They don't want leftovers. That's it, have a pleasant evening, dear colleagues.”

Piper hesitated. It was getting close to 5 and she should hurry home, if only to see whether Hunter needed food or drink or company or… or anything really. Plus it would feel nice to boast about her first day to her mother – and especially to her layabout sister before she went out to another booze fest.

On the other hand, Hunter was growing up and should be able to take care of herself for another hour. Plus Piper just got almost 600 credits, more than another weekly allotment that she couldn't spend anywhere else but in the company. Given the prices she could be spending it a whole month.

What to do?

There was a brief time in the life of Piper Black where she was thin.

All throughout her childhood, Piper had been fat. Growing up poor with a mother eager to band-aid her divorce with copious amounts of cookies, takeout, and quick fixes had never done her any favors. Not only had a lifetime of comfort food left her as the fattest kid in her class, it wasn’t long before she was the fattest kid in her school! By the time she had gotten to middle school, Piper Black was big enough around that she had trouble fitting into desks, and an even harder time getting them to not creak underneath her. Her mother, Harper, had seen the warning signs—she’d put her baby girl on a strict diet, made sure to cook at home more often, and then she let nature do the rest. By the time Piper’s metabolism kicked in, she had shed a good eighty pounds and kept the remainder in all the right places. By the time she entered high school, Piper was a busty, broad-hipped bombshell with dark hair and killer taste in the punk scene. Her active lifestyle of scampering around Daven’s Port on adventures and the shrinking budget of a broken home life meant that Piper simply couldn’t afford to be fat.

But all that changed when the baby came. Little Hunter was an expensive ball of love and black curly hair, and that meant that everyone had to buckle down. Harper went back to work, and so did the rest of the Black women. Her older sister got a job on her feet, but Piper lucked out and scored a neat job where all she needed was good service and she could work right from home. With everyone in the house working again, that meant that there was plenty of portions to go around. The cubbards were filled with snacks again, the freezer stocked with ice cream, and takeout was no longer a once-in-a-while option—in fact, she could afford to have it every day of the week!

It didn’t take long for old habits to resurface. The fat girl that had been sealed away within Piper by the twin gates of poverty and diet was unleashed with a reckless fury, making up for lost time as she scarfed her way through the many moons that she was kept at bay...

And then some.

“What’s it say, what’s it say?”

Standing on her own two feet for so long was like agony for Piper Black now. As she was, almost six hundred pounds, hefting herself from the living room down the hall and into the bathroom, stepping onto the scale and standing there while it calibrated had really knocked the wind out of her. All without a snack to tide her over too—that was the hardest part of this diet. She’d gone so long getting to eat whatever she wanted, whenever she wanted, that the thought of going even a few minutes without something to drop into her hollow leg was lip-bitingly frustrating.

“Let me bend over, god.”

Piper winced as she felt her older sister’s hand push into the bottom of her stomach, propping it up like an avalanche of pizza dough. It hung all the way down to her knees and stuck out far enough that they’d had to push the scale back so that her stomach didn’t get caught on the towel rack. Her fat toes ached, her legs screamed. What she wouldn’t give to just be able to sit on a scale for this…

“Come on, Parker!” Piper whined, “Just read me the goddamn numbers already!”

“It says five hundred and ninety seven pounds.” Parker grunted as she rose to a standing position

“But judging by all these extra inches, I’m guessing your fat ass just broke it.” Parker palmed a portion of Piper’s prodigious paunch and shook it up and down, up and down, forcing her entire volume to jiggle and quake like a flabby earthquake.

“Fuck off, Parker!” Piper groaned, “I knew I shouldn’t have asked you to help me with anything!”

Piper began to slow, laborious process of storming out. She was so big now that she had to make sure to take her time, turn sideways, and step gently out the door so that she didn’t get stuck. That was the last thing that she needed right about now—getting stuck halfway in the bathroom with her bitchy older sister. That would be a riot.

How had it gotten this far? How had she gotten so fat, so fast? It wasn’t like she was trying to bulk up, it just sort’ve… happened! But then again, all the extra food that they could afford now that everyone was working. The trips to the bakery and Big Burger, plus the fact that she didn’t really have to leave anymore unless she wanted to go hang out with friends… yeah, that probably had something to do with it.

But to be almost 600 pounds at just twenty years old? Piper was gonna have to start cutting back if she wanted to stay mobile!

Not that laying around the house couldn’t be fun, just…

She’d only lost three pounds after a week of dieting. And she was starving! There had to be an easier way, right?

Maybe if she got out and cleared her head…

Despite her incredible increase in size the past few years, Piper had maintained a small but dependable social circle of native Daven’s Porters that were more than willing to put up with all things Piper—even as those things got increasingly doughier and flabbier.

Going out at Piper’s size was always a hassle. She almost never had any clothes that fit her, and muumuus were stupid. They made her look like someone’s fat old bubby (actually, it made her look like her own fat old bubby!), and Piper wasn’t about to go out on the town looking like a walking whale of a grandma. Ordering clothes online was always so risky, especially when it became hard to count the X’s on the labels. She might have had more money than normal, but even Piper couldn’t afford to waste precious funds on clothes that were too small for her!

She wound up showing a lot more skin than she intended, but that couldn’t really be helped given her choice of clothing. She’d insisted on wearing the same style, just in bigger sizes. So her jeans may have been practically elastic at this point, but even they had trouble keeping up with Piper’s rolling folds of dough as she waddled out the front door that day.

She was enormous—a beached whale if there ever were one. Her stomach rolled out hard and far in front of her, obscuring her every motion beneath a big bronze curtain of corpulence. Her chest alone was enough to practically blind her, but the belly that brewed below them had long outpaced her growing girls. It swung low, tucked into the stretchy denim as far as it could handle, and still showing by a couple of inches as it weighed the fabric down. Her awkward heaving steps were met with her knees bouncing against her gut like a great big airbag—walking was more of a chore than ever!

Her pillowy arms swung side to side as she waddled to the bus stop. Even given her newfound creed of retaining her mobility, Piper had a hard time not turning around and plopping down on her couch. It was a hot day and she was clearly in no shape to be walking all the way to the bus stop.

“God…” Piper whined, fanning her fat face with a chubby hand, “I need friends with cars…”

No! They were doing exactly what she had told them to do—get her out of the house. And another movie night or gaming session was only going to add even more inches (god, maybe even feet at this rate) to her own circumference.

She was going to have to deal with it and waddle her way to the pier by herself.

Or at least the bus stop.

***


By the time Piper had unwedged herself from the bus doors, she was exhausted. It seemed that even the twenty minute ride from town to the pier couldn’t let her catch her second wind. It seemed like just about the time she managed to stop wheezing on the poor guy next to her, she had to hoist herself up to a standing position and waddle on out the doors.

Back in the sun.

Back in the hot.

God she wanted to go home.

“Piper!” came a voice further down the beach.

Crap.

“Hey Sam!” Piper waved one of her wobbly arms weakly, “Hey Jay, hey Madi!”

Three of Piper’s closest friends were the ones who were the most adamant about getting her out and about. She had blown up so fast over the years that they still looked twice whenever they saw her—but at the same time, they never overtly judged her about her weight. Sam worked at a movie theatre down town, Jay worked as a barista and a bassist for some band, and Madi worked at D’s Donuts, so they were always willing to coax Piper out with a good time, even as she got heavier and heavier.

As she waddled onto the creaking wood of the old pier, her friend’s forms came into better view…

145121.content:
As she waddled closer, Piper's spirits lifted ever so slightly from the familiar sight of her friends. As much as she would have preferred to stay in today, it did feel nice to be in good company.

"Yo, Piper!" Sam sauntered over, one hand raised in a wave and ready for a high-five. "Glad you came!"

"Glad I did," Piper laughed weakly, still winded from the trip. She met Sam's raised palm with her own, the action causing her arm to quiver and a sea of ripples to travel past her limb and to all over her body.

"What up, P?" Jay drawled, raising a casual fist.

"Hey Jay," Piper returned the fist-bump.

So that was Sam and Jay. That only left...

"Piper!" Madi cheered, her footsteps making the old wooden planks creak alarmingly as she all but jiggled over, her giant belly hitting Piper's globular paunch first before she threw her arms around the other girl in as much an embrace as she could manage. "Good to see you!"

"Y-You too..." Piper said, returning the embrace as best as she could.

The pier floor groaned beneath them, and for a second Piper was sure it was going to collapse right under them.

Why shouldn't it? Both Madi and her were the resident fatties of the group, both weighing in the same range, with Piper still the heavier one of the two.

It hadn't always been like this. Granted, Madi had always been on the chubby side, even back when Piper was still thin. Then she began to frequent D's Donuts & Malts, where Madi worked. The two quickly struck up a tight friendship, bound by a mutual love of the high-calorie sweets, and the fact they found the time to emotionally support one another. Piper would order an entire box of donuts when feeling down or just very hungry, and Madi was happy to be her "big eater bestie". Madi would need a friend when distraught from either a relationship fallout with an ex-boyfriend, or work being particularly stressful, and Piper was ever a loyal, present friend.

And they just liked to eat out a lot, their combined appetites making most of their hangout plans one of the many eateries around town. It was no wonder they'd both gotten so big. Yet Piper couldn't help but feel responsible for Madi's ballooning waistline. She used to be just chubby, plump even.

Now Madi's belly had grown from a noticeable, yet cute with its tininess, pot to a multi-rolled gut that was pushing mightily against her sweatshirt and hanging out of her sweatpants, leaving a big pale slab of blubber exposed. Her arms and legs looked like they had been inflated with lard, completely puffy and saggy with fat fingers and toes on chubby hands and feet. Her thighs were quite big, her behind looking to be about the second biggest part of her, everything else, chest included, paling in the face of her dominating belly. Even her face, once simply round, was now coated with fat cheeks and extra chins, her neck nearly covered by that layer of facial flab.

Even now, Piper wasn't sure what to feel. It was a bit comforting not being the only landwhale in the group, a truth that left her feeling guilty. She felt even more guilty Madi may have gotten this fat because of her. She would never want to wish the discomfort of enormity on anyone. The struggle of just getting up and stay standing under her own power, the exhaustion from even the simplest walks, the need to find bigger clothes after outgrowing them, the seemingly endless hunger...

"Uh, Pipes?" Madi said, fat face creasing in concern. "Are you...okay?"

"Huh? Oh, yeah, sorry, just...spaced out. Tired, is all."

Madi smiled sympathetically, giving Piper's meaty shoulder a tender pat.

"Right, we're here, so let's get this party started!" Sam announced, clapping her hands to get everyone's attention.

"What about Max?" Jay asked.

"What about her?" Sam rolled her eyes. "Not our fault she can't manage time. So, what are our options?"

"Carnival just opened up," Jay held out an arm to indicate the other side of the pier.

"Sounds great, but..." Madi made a face and brought her hands down to rest on her belly. "I don't really want to walk around much. It's too hot out, today..."

"Well, what would you suggest, then?" Jay asked, reaching into his pocket for his pack of cigarettes.

"How about we go for a bite? Y'know, sit down, air-conditioned building, eat and talk..." she shot a meaningful look at the bassist, whom didn't notice at all, much to her disappointment. "Like Nitoli's. Anyone up for pizza?" she finished dully.

Sam merely rolled her eyes and turned to Piper. "What do you say, P?"

Piper blinked, thinking over the options, and deciding to add her own. "Uhh...movie at your theater?"

"Ooh! Movie!" Madi squealed, jiggling where she stood as she clapped her hands together. "I'm down for that!"

"Eh, I've seen the listings, and they're all crap," Jay retorted, lighting his cancer stick after a few flicks of the lighter.

"Judging by what the reviewers say instead of seeing it for yourself?" Sam snarked.

"Hey, excuse me for wanting to save us from wasting time and money," Jay shrugged.

"Yeah, well, we can still have a good time laughing at a bad movie," Piper offered, shifting slightly on her feet. They were getting sore, and no matter what they agreed on, she just wanted a place to sit. Madi did, too, judging by the look on her face and how she was similarly subtly shifting her feet ever so slightly.

"Your call, girl," Sam smiled, reaching over and patting Piper on her fluffy backside. "What do you want us to do?"

Piper took a moment to think it over, finally deciding on...

14513221.content:
Piper's job was not a difficult one.

Like many of the Daven's Port youth would in the coming years, Piper got a job at the Yeng Corporation fresh out of high school. This was back when it hadn't quite taken hold of the community as it would eventually go on to, and it was still trying to find its foothold in the States. Piper was one of the first wave of employees to be hired on in the (then) new Research & Development department, and had been nestled comfortably in her position there ever since.

Yeng was something like an umbrella corporation. It provided technological goods primarily, but in its success overseas it had branched out into things like apparel, home and office supplies, and eventually wound up starting its own line of designer foods and food products. As a member of the R&D team, Piper often joked that she was a lab rat, but it wasn't that far off of a comparison.

At an entry level position, Yeng paid Piper twelve dollars an hour at forty hours a week to sit on her butt and test various products before they hit the larger consumer market. Her input, among many others in the department, would determine whether or not these products were "ready" to hit the market. She was given access to all kinds of cool tech to play with, got to listen to music all day, and was given her own private testing area after six months of quality performance. It was any lazy girl's dream job, and even before she started blowing back up again, Piper wasn't exactly one to work particularly hard for her money.

The only "problem" (as in, it had only become a problem once Piper realized that she couldn't stop herself from porking out) was that it was all the snacks that she could eat. Even back when she was rocking a tiny waist, Piper could knock back some snacks without realizing it. It was the fat girl inside of her, banging on her ribs to get out. In fact, snacking on the job was encouraged, practically a requirement even when she was testing things like armchair durability and stereo quality. After two years of her willpower eroding away with free snacks and tempting discounts on all the high-tech Yeng products, plenty of opportunities for pay raises leaving her with little reasons to want to go anywhere else, Piper had become the model Yeng employee.

Or at least that was what her supervisor, Dr. Helen Schwartz, seemed to think.

The little blue-haired woman had been watching her favorite employee expand for years, her pet project going from skinny to plump to porky and beyond was her end-all be-all for her workplace. She had been given many opportunities to thrive in a place like Yeng, where her sadistic streak and eye for consumer behavior and psychology were put to good use. But to her, she served her purpose well.

Why be trapped in a Corporate Office, stuffed in a desk somewhere, where she could have a more hands-on approach right here?

Heading the R&D department meant that, not only could she "improve" some of the various products that they provided, but also that she could make her own improvements to the staff...

And Piper Black had been a personal favorite of hers since the beginning.

"You look tired, liebchen." Dr. Schwartz clicked her tongue in a worried way, "Are you not sleeping enough?"

Piper, heifer that she was, was still tired from her trek. The handicap spot in the Yeng parking lot seemed to get further and further away with every pound that Piper gained, so of course she looked a mess. Her black hair was frizzy, pulled into two pigtails that rested on her meaty shoulders and on either side of her colossal chest. An ocean of olive skin heaved up and down, up and down, as her calamitous mams rose and fell like fleshy empires. Her face was red and blotchy, her plump lips parted as she wheezed away on her itty-bitty boss.

"I... not really..." Piper puffed, wiping the sweat from her brow as she lumbered towards her station, ready to begin her long day of Research & Development...

"I mean..." Piper said after some thoughtful consideration, "I guess, if I really want anything it'd just be to... you know... be able to move my body again."

As if to emphasize her point, the couch beneath Piper let loose a protesting groan at her slight movement. Dr. Schwartz made a mental note to have the true capacity of her furniture tested. But it really helped drive home the fact that Piper Black was almost six hundred pounds of woman. She had no right being so heavy, or being so big that her supervisor had to make mental notes regarding the stability of the literally steel-reinforced couch beneath her.

She was a total blob, and a day didn't go by that Piper didn't feel every pound that her immense expanse commanded. Even sitting down, now, her movement was restricted. She couldn't make direct eye contact with the tiny German woman sitting behind the desk; her face was too fat and her chins too thick. Her shoulders were too meaty, and her breath too short. But she couldn't turn to face her because of the great amount of energy that such a feat would require. Her gut parted her legs out to either side of her, meaning that she had to kick one of them out at an angle just to keep herself stable. Even reclined and relaxed, Piper's hot wet breathing sounded labored—Piper was miserably overweight, and she wanted desperately to do something about it.

Thus the dieting. Well, thus the attempt at dieting. Attempts, as her file folder showed. Piper had always been big, but she'd never been this big before. No one in her family had. Heck, most people in the history of the world had never gotten as big and as fat as Piper Black. She was a cow, a whale, all of the mean things that they used to call her back in elementary school times like a zillion. And she felt trapped in her own blobby body.

And, though she could have never known it, the smile that spread across Dr. Schwartz's face was a silent reassurance that those days would soon be long behind her.

"Ach—you are never going to believe this." she said, gesturing emptily to some far-off corner of some far-off room, "But I think, if you give me just a little bit of time, I may have an answer to your predicament."

***


It was another three days of comfort binging before Piper would learn just what it was that Dr. Schwartz had in mind.

That was how it worked with Piper. One day of discomfort could set her back weeks, months, or evidently years of dieting. Her dismay at failing to lose more than three pounds of denying herself anything and everything her greedy guts required had lead her to practically emptying out her house. The rounded tummies of the other Black women weren't pleased in the slightest, but stood no chance at making Piper feel any worse than she already did, several thousand calories into noon by lunchtime.

On all days for her life to change, it was on a Thursday. Nothing particularly special, except for the fact that this marked the fourth day in a row that Piper had come into work feeling like the biggest, fattest piece of shit in Daven's Port. Sam and Max and Madi and Jay had all done their part in trying to make her feel better, but the only way that those fatties knew how to cheer anyone up was with food, and lots of it. Something that Piper was already well accustomed with.

In fact, she was already biting into her second muffin of the day when Dr. Schwartz found her.

"Ah, it's Piper!" she said in her thick accent, "Just the associate that I was looking for—come, come with me fraulein."

And the tiny woman grabbed Piper by the thick, padded hand and lead her down the hall and into her office...

As it turned out, Dr. Schwartz had spent a long time thinking about Piper's predicament. And she had come up with a solution to all (or rather, most) of Piper's problems. Albeit, not in the way that any sane woman would have thought.

Dr. Schwartz was going to solve Piper's problem...

The process of moving Piper out of the Black family home wasn't nearly as arduous as one would have thought. Given that she was basically a glorified guinea pig for her parent company, moving her to a more controlled environment was going to be the end result anyway at the rate she was going. Doing it a few months in advance (initially a year, but Piper's expedient growth had already meant an early forecast) wasn't going to break anyone's budget or throw the projections of their project out of whack. On the contrary—Dr. Schwartz's personal sponsorship of the project in the proposal she'd made to Dr. Hinamizawa was much less expensive. Rather than set aside one of the newly constructed Yeng homes ("Goldfish Models" they called them), Piper would be moving in with her.

"And what do you propose we do with all of the funds that we have already allocated into the Black home, Dr. Schwartz?" Fukuda's fat, flat face creased at the corners of her mouth, open wide as she helped herself to another mouthful of her especially plump pink duck. "You are aware that we cannot simply abandon the renovations that we have made in the name of success, yes?"

Regardless of the ownership that Helen felt over the younger, significantly larger subject, moving her into her home without the approval of her higher-ups would definitely complicate things. Piper was, for all intents and purpose, a Yeng asset now that she had received the experimental injections that had allowed her to... no, enabled her to live at such an extraordinarily high weight so comfortably. And while it wouldn't have been the first time that Helen had made off with property that wasn't technically (or legally) hers at the expense of the approval of her financial backers. But in order to give Piper the life that Helen felt she so desperately deserved, a certain level of comfort was going to have to be maintained. And that came with the necessary amount of officious obfuscation that Yeng specialized in.

Luckily for Helen, Fukuda was much more easily swayed these days.

In the time that it had taken Piper to put on another hundred pounds, Fukuda had easily matched that. As payment for Evie's cooperation in getting Piper's friends their injections, Helen had kept to her word about working against their boss. Evie's long-standing, visceral and loathing attraction for the prim and proper head of their department had been something they'd spoken about for years. The tall, sadistic scientist absolutely adored the idea of the high and mighty Hinamizawa succumbing to carnal pleasures almost as much as Helen adored Piper. In a compromise, Helen had been steadily sabotaging her higher-up's every attempt to combat her growing girth.

"Ach, I knew you were going to say that." Helen said jokingly as she lathered the duck in a thick creamy gravy, to the approval of her porking employer, "Would you like some more?"

"Yes please." Fukuda purred huskily as she watched the brown sauce spread over her meal, "Just a bit."

Helen gave her much more than just a bit. As she explained the benefits of Piper moving into her personal living space, rather than a sterilized and artificial environment, Helen took a small amount of pride in how little attention her boss was paying her. The food was divine, surely (Helen may not have known how to properly cook a duck, but working for Yeng had its perks!) but she could almost see Fukuda's mind getting lost in the sensation of her latest meal. Helen could understand Evie's attraction to their boss—seeing the stern, powerful woman melt like a pudgy little puddle in light of her latest meal was quite cute! Perhaps, in another hundred or so pounds, watching her get tired from waddling around the office...

No. Well, yes. But not right now. That was pleasure—she was here for business. Or was it the other way around? It was getting so hard to tell these days...

"The long and short of it is..." Helen smiled wickedly as she leaned back into the dining chair, her finger steepled over her plump tum, "We turn one experiment into two."

***


When Piper had moved out, an entirely different set of weight had settled on Harper's shoulders. She hadn't enjoyed the idea of her little girl having to make it on her own in her condition, especially after having been so good about everything. First the baby, then being the breadwinner, and then of course there was her weight gain. Piper's life hadn't been easy, that much was for sure, but Harper was sure that she could handle it. Now that she was living with Dr. Schwartz, Piper was going to be much happier.

They all were. Now that there was some wiggle room.

Piper's 700+ pounds had really taken up a lot of space in the already cozy Black house. No matter where she went, Piper had dominated every room of the house and had on plenty of occasions gotten corked in the hallway. Thank goodness for her bosses at Yeng giving her such good insurance. The whole family owed that company a lot, but Piper's living there would have been all but impossible if her size hadn't been covered by their corporate insurance policy. With Yeng backing them, they had been afforded a lot of things. Renovations, yes. The expensive furniture meant to account for Piper's sheer size and the slight modifications that they'd made to the hallways and the bathrooms given her "disability", not to mention all of the food that they'd given them discounts on.

And all of it was just there. No Piper around to gobble it all up or take up the whole couch, and yet her presence was still very much felt. The Yeng delivery van was still bringing by Piper's regular truckload of groceries every Friday (Harper had noted with some displeasure that it was no longer the cute, older Saul and he had been replaced by someone closer to Parker's age who was much more attractive but did not share his predecessor's willingness to flirt with her!) and life still went on as though the big fat Black daughter was still lumbering around the house. And it didn't look like it was going to stop any time soon.

It might have been because they all worked for Yeng, Harper thought with her tummy bulging out from underneath her tank top as she leaned ass-out into the bottom of their cavernous fridge. The paperwork just hadn't been worked out, and they hadn't realized that Piper no longer lived with them?

Always asking about how the baby was and making sure to bring plenty of yummy snacks for Harper to snack on. She'd even gotten Parker a work-from-home job from her computer! Surely she couldn't have thought Harper was as terrible as she told herself she was. Kicking her most responsible daughter out like that...

Instead of worrying about her daughter from the other room, about her increasingly enormous size and about how they were going to go broke trying to feed her, Harper found herself worrying about Piper from the other side of the spectrum!

"You better not eat my drumsticks." Harper blushed as she felt chilled belly flesh brush against her big brown badonk, "I will literally kill you if you eat my drumsticks."

Parker's fleshy gut poured into a single olive-colored apron of fat, untucked from her loose gray sweats as it wobbled in place. Parker folded her plush hammy arms underneath her breasts, bunching up her double chin as she made a face of utter Millenial consternation. Harper sheepishly put the ice cream cones back and bumped the fridge door shut with her sizeable booty.

"What? No, I um..." Harper smiled awkwardly, squishy gut squelching in desire, "I was just getting some milk for Hunter."

"Top shelf, ma." Parker grunted as she pushed past her mother, "Now if you'll just move so I can get my ice cream."

"Hey, I'm your mother and if I want my ice cream—!"

The two swelling subjects bickered, bellies brushing against one another as jabs were traded and insults lobbed. With the steady "modifications" that Helen had been making on the two of them on the clock and off, subliminally and psychoactively, she would see to it that they would reap exactly what they had sewn with how they treated poor Piper. With the strings she'd pulled with Fukuda, Helen had promised her that none of the resources Yeng had already put into that house would go to waste.

Watching them scrabble and squawk like two fattened pigeons fighting for crumbs from the Fridge Cam, Helen was confident that her promise would not go unfulfilled.

For most of her tenure at Yeng, Piper had spent her time being unwittingly fattened up by a number of people. There were plenty of spoons in the pot that was plumping up Piper Black, but none of them were more prominent or proficient at the task than Dr. Helen Schwartz. Whether it was because it was her job to oversee such a development (in the beginning, what seemed like a lifetime ago, that's all it was) or because she had genuinely grown fond of Piper and wanted to show that affection in ways that just happened to involve very fattening, very enabling behaviors—Helen had a lot to do with the way that Piper was now.

It was only fitting that, thanks in part to the way Piper was now, the reverse would become true.

Living with Piper meant that there was simultaneously a lot of food and almost no food at all in the house. With the sheer quantity that she ate throughout the day, enough to feed a team of Olympic gold medalists there needed to be an excessive amount of access to food. And as the injections began to wane at Piper's still increasing size, she was steadily becoming less and less mobile again. While much more sturdy than a woman who weighed more than 700 pounds had any right to be, Piper came to rely a lot on Dr. Schwartz.

"Helen, please, call me Helen." the good doctor's round cheeks bunched up into deep dimples as she touched Piper's puddling pillow of upper arm wing, "Ach, you still do this."

By the time Helen had wheeled the latest addition to the day's lunch of many courses in front of her couch-sized charge, Piper had not only forgotten what she'd done to earn her roommate and handler's gentle reminder, but she'd also completely checked out for lunch. Her big brown bovine eyes were hazy and her attention was scarce as she moved her hammy arms with surprising and inspiring speeds across the trolleys that Helen had spread her lunch across. She operated entirely on instinct, her acres of arm fat trembling as she hurried the food into her mouth. Hunched forward to better reach over her stupendous beanbag breasts, Piper operated entirely on instinct.

Under the hungry sounds of Piper's feasting, her grunting, and heavy breathing, Helen watched as her friend and unwitting test subject enjoyed herself. She had always loved to watch Piper eat. She seemed at her happiest, even back when she was a skinny teenager applying for the position when she was indulging herself. It made sense, given her family's history of poverty, but Helen could empathize and even relate to Piper's piggish point of view.

She'd spent so long staying at a manageable weight—her hedonistic desires kept in check by a somewhat demanding career at the Yeng Offices. No longer could she gorge on her favorite foods endlessly, at least not without consequence. Her iron-clad self-control was a point of pride, as was her ability to overcome any and all temptation (though not always happily). No obstacle was too small for Helen Schwartz, but was weight even becoming an obstacle anymore?

Looking at Piper, sucking down a hearty mix of German and Mexican cuisine prepared by none other than the good doctor herself, her mind occupied and all of her needs fulfilled, Helen had a thought.

"I want that."

After all, who was going to tell her that she couldn't? Fukuda? Not with how she had her eating out of the palm of her hand. There was no reason any longer to cut back or deny herself.

And so she wouldn't—Helen did what she wanted. And now? Helen wanted to get fat.

***


Piper's piggy eyes brightened at the sight of all the extra portions being brought to her today. The greedy gears in her brain began to work into overdrive, driven into an especially excited lurch towards the trollies being wheeled in her direction. But when her hands had almost reached the first cart, greedy mitts nearly touching the serving tray of some kielbasa dish that Helen had taught her how to love, she felt a sting on the back of her palm.

"Ach!" Helen reprimanded gently, "That one is mine."

"But..." Piper's eyes watered at the thought of being told 'no' for the first time in what was far, far too long

"No buts, schatzen." Helen said sternly, "I will be joining you for lunch today."

"You eat lunch with me every day." Piper pouted, rubbing the back of her hand petulantly

"No, I serve you lunch every day." Helen corrected, settling in a seat catty-cornered to Piper's sofa, "I think it is time that I enjoy myself during these mealtimes too, ja?"

"...ja." Piper relented, "Can we eat soon? I haven't had anything since breakfast."

"Of course, mein liebchen." the doughy doctor smiled literally licking her lips in anticipation of what was to be a grand meal, Piper looking on in disappointment and shock as Helen took from what she had assumed as her extra big portion, "Now we can truly eat..."

No matter how late she came home, the house was clean and orderly, a plate of food or something in the slow cooker was waiting, and Hunter was soundly asleep in her bed as Harper came to give her a kiss goodnight.

At Thanksgiving, her booty overhung the sides of her chair. By New Years, she was spread across two chairs, and struggling to fit.

It was just a little bit of weight, right?

Harper was really regretting enabling her daughter's spiraling weight gain now, let me tell ya.

She was constantly snacking, and the scale of those snacks always seemed to be on the rise. "I mean, for Christ's sake, she just ate an entire tray of cinnamon buns as an after-breakfast snack..."

Her daily movement likely wouldn't even total a thousand yards, and none of that any faster then a slow walk. Combine that with a diet that likely broke 10 or 20,000 calories a day, and it was no wonder she'd gotten so huge.

Harper really didn't know what to do at this point. Piper was so very big, and showed no signs of slowing down. Worst of all, it was like she couldn't help by enable her even more, as it only seemed to take the slightest bit of pushing by the blobby girl to convince her Mom to get her even more food. "Parker!" Harper shouted. Piper, meanwhile, could only let out a whimper as her belly let out another rumbling growl...
